Description: Limestone lamp with an oval rounded body and a raised rim decorated with a spiral rosette round the filling-hole, and vines in high relief on each side. The rounded tapering nozzle is defined from the body by double ridges. At the rear is a broad ring handle, mostly lost. The lamp stands on a base-ring. The surface is darkened; possibly a dark brown paint, or perhaps caused by oil-staining.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3965)
